DataElement.preferredName: Central Reviewer Scan Confirmation Disease Recurrent Progression Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for a central reviewer to critically evaluate and confirm whether or not the data or image information obtained by a sensing device identified worsening disease or return of disease after remission.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Reviewer Confirmation Malignant Neoplasm Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Scan
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data._Having been established or verified._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The return of a disease after a period of remission._The worsening of a disease over time._The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data.

Concepts.definition: A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data.

Property.preferredName: Confirmation Malignant Neoplasm Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Scan
Property.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:The worsening of a disease over time.:The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
